e="preserve">Agustín Roberto Radrizzani, SDB (September 22, 1944 – September 2, 2020) was an Argentine prelate of the Roman Catholic Church. He was Archbishop of Mercedes-Luján from 2007 until 2019.
Radrizzani became a priest on March 25, 1972.
On May 14, 1991, he became the Bishop of Neuquén by Pope John Paul II.
He was later named Bishop of Lomas de Zamora on April 24, 2001. He was promoted by Pope Benedict XVI to Archbishop of Mercedes-Luján on December 27, 2007.
He died on September 2, 2020 from COVID-19, aged 75.
